Settings_Controller_ShowBindingCalloutsI: Show Binding On Controllers in VR
Settings_ThumbstickDeadzone_Desc: Adjust the deadzone on all thumbsticks.
Settings_NeedSteamTo_ViewAndEditBindings: Launch Steam to view and edit bindings.
VRMonitor_Overview_QuickLinks_Tutorial_D: Learn to use your VR Headset
Settings_Audio_HDMIGain: Gain reduction on VIVE HDMI Audio
Settings_Audio_SpeakerJackOutput_Title: Allows simultaneous audio through both the 3.5mm jack and the off-ear speakers
Advanced_DisableDirectModeWarning: Disabling Direct Mode extends the headset's display onto the OS desktop. This adds latency to the VR experience, and is not recommended for normal users.
Advanced_QuickCalibrate_Explanation: Quickly reset your Room Setup. New bounds will be centered on your headset on the floor in the center of your space.
Settings_EnableWebHelperDebuggerDesc: Enables debugging server for attaching Chromium dev tools and debugger to embedded Chromium pages. It's always enabled on Perforce builds.
Advanced_PerfGraphInHMD: Show GPU Performance Graph in Headset
Explanation_DisableEnhancedPowerManageme: Disable Windows Enhanced Power Management for SteamVR USB Devices if you experience a mysterious loss of tracking or an inability to pair wireless controllers.
Explanation_QuickCalibrate: Quickly reset your Room Setup. For Standing and Room Scale VR new bounds will be centered on your headset on the floor in the center of your space.
Explanation_RebootVive: Reset your headset - this may fix USB related headset issues.
Explanation_RemoveAllSteamVRUSBDevices: Remove all USB devices related to SteamVR from this system to reinstall drivers.
Explanation_ResetDismissableWarnings: Temporary warnings are reset and will show again as needed.
Settings_Developer_TrackingDataSavedSucc: Tracking Data Saved Successfully to path:
Settings_DebugInputBindings: Enable debugging options in the input binding user interface
Settings_FadeToGrid: Fade To Grid on app hang
Settings_EnableDashboardDesc: Allow the VR Dashboard to be summoned in response to a system button press.
Settings_AutoShowGameTheater: Present Non-VR Applications on Theater Screen Upon Launch
Settings_AutoShowGameTheaterDesc: When launching a non-vr application from Steam, automatically display that application on the theater screen.
Settings_InputCaptureEnabledDesc: Clicking on floating or controller attached overlays while the dashboard is dismissed, activates laser mouse.
Settings_HomeAppDesc: Enjoy virtual environments, social features, and more.
Settings_LockedModeDesc: Allow rendering to headset while computer is locked.
Settings_PauseOnStandby: Pause VR when headset is idle
Settings_PauseOnLocked: Pause VR when computer is locked
Settings_NightModeDesc: Dim the headset until 5:00 AM (or until SteamVR is restarted).
Settings_StatusWindowMinimizeToTray_Text: When minimized, SteamVR Status minimizes to the system tray
Settings_SuppressWarnings_Text: Suppress warnings and alerts when SteamVR Status is minimized
Settings_KnockKnock_Desc: This allows people outside of VR to get the headset user's attention
Settings_Video_RefreshRate_NotFound: Additional refresh rates are supported by your HMD, but were not detected by the graphics driver. Please verify your headset firmware and graphics drivers are up to date.
Settings_Video_RefreshRate_NotAvailableE: Additional refresh rates are supported by your HMD, but SteamVR cannot manage refresh rates when the HMD is in extended mode.
Settings_Video_RefreshRate_OneSupported: Only one refresh rate is supported for your system.
Settings_Video_MaxRecommendedResolutionR: A third-party driver has limited your maximum render resolution on all headsets.
A third-party driver has limited your maximum render resolution on all headsets to %1$s.

When you remove this limit, you will be able to use the sliders to choose a higher resolution. We recommend going back to default render resolution when removing this limit to avoid unexpected performance changes.
Remove the limit and reset render resolution to a safe value.
Only remove the limit, don't change other settings.
Settings_Video_AppResFooter: The current setting renders each eye at %1$s
Settings_Advanced_MotionSmoothing_Descri: Synthesizes new frames to maintain a good experience when the running application cannot keep up.
Settings_Advanced_MotionSmoothing_Disabl: Motion smoothing not supported on this GPU / driver version (requires asynchronous reprojection support).
Motion Smoothing is not supported on older versions of Windows.
Settings_Advanced_Supersampling_Warning: The setting below overrides the automated setting and affects all applications. To change the resolution for a specific application, visit Applications Settings.
Explanation_Supersampling_Header: SteamVR automatically sets your application resolution based on the performance of your GPU.
Explanation_Supersampling: *Some applications may need to be restarted for settings to take effect.
Settings_PerApplication_AppResHeader: This setting is a multiplier on top of the current global application resolution setting on the %1$s tab to the left. This application may need to be restarted for settings to take effect. (Default is 100%)
Settings_PerApplication_OverlayVisibleHe: Overlay applications are available as tabs in the SteamVR Dashboard.
Settings_PerApplication_OverlayVisibleCh: Start this overlay application when SteamVR launches.
Settings_PerApplication_MotionSmoothing_: Use the checkbox below to override the global setting for Motion Smoothing for this application. (Global setting for Motion Smoothing is <font color=#eeeeee>%1</font>)
Warning: Application will run at half framerate
Enable motion smoothing for this application
Settings_PerApplication_Reprojection_Des: Checking this option will disable asynchronous reprojection for this title.
Settings_Perapplication_RefreshRateOverr: Checking this option will allow specifying a different refresh rate from the global setting for this application.
Settings_PerApplication_ThrottlingOverri: Throttling and prediction are handled automatically based on measured performance, however, some applications may benefit from forcing to run at a fixed slower rate in order to provide an overall smoother experience.
Selecting a fixed throttling value here will disable automatic throttling for this application.
Settings_PerApplication_WorldScale_Descr: Override application's perceived scaling by adjusting head movement and eye separation.
Settings_PerApplication_WorldScale_Warni: Note: Changes may require application restart, and/or modify interactions in unexpected ways. Depending on the application, features such as throwing may be affected.
Settings_PerApplication_FovScale_Descrip: Optionally lower the application's field of view in order to trade-off peripheral vision for clarity. Note: In many cases, the application will need to be restarted for the change to be applied properly.
Settings_MimeTypes_Pancake_Header: Select an application to launch 2D applications in
Settings_Camera_ShowOnController_Desc: Turns on a camera window attached to your controller when the Dashboard is up.
Settings_Camera_AllowCameraForRoomView_D: Access Room View at any time by double clicking the System button
Settings_Camera_CompatibilityExplanation: If you experience a loss of tracking you may want to set a lower Camera Rate, disable the camera, or try a different USB port.
Settings_Camera_AntiFlicker_Desc: Set Light Source Frequency detection mode
Settings_Camera_RoomView3D_Unsupported: Room View 3D is not supported on this headset / system configuration.
Settings_Appearance_Background_NoSteam: Launch Steam to see any any additional backgrounds.
Settings_Appearance_BackgroundDesc: Pick a background for the default space
Settings_Appearance_UseDomeProjectionDes: Changes the projection style of the background image. Certain background use this feature to give a more immersive experience. If the background you selected looks distorted, try enabling this
Settings_Appearance_DomeCameraHeightDesc: Adjusts the height of the camera relative to the background
Settings_Appearance_DomeCameraRadiusDesc: Changes the size of the dome.
Settings_Appearance_PlayAreaColorDesc: Adjust the style of your play area. You will see this when games are loading, or if you have disabled SteamVR Home Beta
Settings_Power_ControllerOffOnExit: Turn off controllers when exiting SteamVR
Settings_General_CalibrateThumbstick_Con: Connect a controller with a thumbstick.
Settings_General_NotEnoughSamples: Please press up on the thumbstick at least %1$s more times to complete calibration.
Settings_General_InviteMoreSamples: Calculated angle of %1$s°. Keep pressing up to refine that value or press Confirm to accept this calibration.
Settings_Dashboard_GrabHandleAcceleratio: Accelerate push and pull movement of grab handles.
Settings_Dashboard_KeyboardPrivacy_Disab: Warning: Disabling keyboard privacy will allow games to stream controller poses while the VR keyboard is in use. Please be careful entering passwords or other sensitive information on the VR keyboard while using multi-player / social applications.
Settings_Chaperone_SuitableForSmall: Suitable for small playspaces. Use caution.
Settings_MustRestart_Description: SteamVR must be restarted for some changes to take effect.
Settings_MustQuitApp_Description: Please quit the current game for changes to take effect.
Settings_AdditionalSettingsAvailable: Additional settings available upon headset detection.
Settings_ViveTracker_Identify_NotIdentif: Vive Tracker isn't capable of identification.
Settings_StartTheseOverlayAppsOnLaunch: Start These Overlay Apps On Launch:
Settings_Drivers_UnblockAllTip: NOTE: Unblocking and testing one add-on at a time is recommended.
Settings_Drivers_SomeBlocked: Due to a recent crash, some SteamVR Add-Ons have been automatically blocked.
Settings_OpenXR_MetaPluginCompatibilityT: EXPERIMENTAL: May create unwanted behavior. Set to have SteamVR try to simulate Meta's OpenXR Unity plugin requirements.
TestController_NoController: Turn on a controller to test it.
